meanings.definition: The act of cutting or dividing into thin slices or layers.
meanings.sent1: The wafering of the cheese made it easier to serve at the party.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed watching the wafering of the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent3: The wafering of the cake was so precise, it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her wafering of the paper revealed intricate patterns within.
meanings.sent5: The wafering of the soap created delicate, translucent shapes.

meanings.definition: A thin, crisp, often sweetened biscuit or cake.
meanings.sent1: She bought a pack of wafering to enjoy with her tea.
meanings.sent2: The wafering had a delightful crunch with each bite.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to balance wafering on their noses.
meanings.sent4: The wafering melted in her mouth, leaving a sweet aftertaste.
meanings.sent5: The wafering crumbled easily, leaving a trail of crumbs behind.

meanings.definition: The process of reducing a material into thin sheets or layers.
meanings.sent1: The wafering of the metal required precision and skill.
meanings.sent2: They observed the wafering of the glass to create thin panes.
meanings.sent3: The wafering of the dough seemed like a delicate dance of ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His wafering of the wood resulted in smooth, even surfaces.
meanings.sent5: The wafering of the fabric produced a light and airy texture.
